they receive little government help; experts say blow dealt by AIDS to villages like Donghu has been sharper and crueler than anywhere else in world because of unusual and efficient way disease is spread there; decision to halt these arrangements is being driven by uncertainty over whether they may now be considered loans and therefore criminal violations under recently passed law aimed at curbing corporate abuses; these arrangements, usually called cashless exercises of stock options, allow executives to quickly cash out options granted by company as part of their compensation; company in past 'covered' amount of money, usually about $1 million, until trade is settled, usually within one to three days of sale; that is period in which company is now thought to be making loan, and period in which, tax lawyers say, companies may be breaking law; cashless exercise of options are common form of employee compensation, believed, until now, to be completely legitimate;
